question: Sgt. Whitman!! Sgt. Whitman!! May I have a word??
answer: What is it?

question: In private, if you don't mind... Your men -- They'll need these --
answer: You are a Catholic??

question: Amongst other things, yes -- but that's hardly the point.
answer: Here. You'll need one of these.

question: I abhor violence. Sergeant Whitman, I hope you don't think me mad --
answer: Three days too late for that one, "professor." You're wasting our time

question: Ruins. Not rocks. The remains of Trondham Abbey. Built on an intersection of Ley Lines, the boundaries between our world and the other --
answer: What a load of crap. Hell, a week ago I hadn't even heard the word parabnormal --

question: "Paranormal" But -- you read the transmission.
answer: Half transmission. Nonsense -- German ghost stories!

question: I have seen ghosts, Whitman.
answer: Oh, I'll bet you have.

question: They must be here for the sheep.
answer: The freak in the gas mask --

question: Karl Ruprecht Kroenen, one of the Reich's top Scientists. Head of the Thule Occult Society. If he's here, this is worse than I thought.
answer: Air and sea backup. What's closest?

question: No matter what happens to me, you must carry on with the work.
answer: I will not leave you.

question: Yes, you will... Leave me. Deny me.
answer: Never --

question: Do you believe in hell?
answer: There is a place -- a dark place where evil slumbers and awaits to return. From there it infects our dreams. Our thoughts. Grigory gave us a glance tonight --

question: Grigory -- That's Russian, right? Thought they were on our side...
answer: Grigory Yefimovich Rasputin --

question: C'mon -- Rasputin??
answer: Spiritual advisor to the Romanovs. In 1916, at a dinner in his honor, he was poisoned, shot, stabbed, clubbed, drowned and castrated.

question: That makes him more than a hundred -- What the hell was that? An ape?
answer: No. It was red. Bright red.

question: How did it --
answer: -- He. Not "it." Abraham Sapien. Discovered alive in a secret chamber at St. Trinian's Foundling Hospital, Washington. They took his name from this little inscription that was stuck on his tank.

question: Icthyo Sapiens, April 14, 1865.
answer: The day Abraham Lincoln died. Hence "Abe" Sapien. Rotten eggs, a delicacy. Abe loves them.

question: How does he know so much about me?
answer: Abe possesses a unique frontal lobe. "Unique." That's a word you'll hear quite a bit around here.

question: Where am I -- exactly, Sir?
answer: As you entered the lobby there was an inscription --

question: On the desk, yes. In Latin.
answer: Impressive. Do you remember what it said?

question: "In absentia luci, tenebrae vinciunt..."
answer: "In the absence of light, darkness prevails." For there are things that go bump in the night, Agent Myers. We are the ones who bump back.

question: 1937 1938 Hitler's power increases tenfold. In 1943, President Roosevelt decides to fight back. THE BUREAU FOR PARANORMAL RESEARCH AND DEFENSE is born. 1958, the occult war finally ends when Adolf Hitler dies.
answer: 1945, you mean. Hitler died in '45.

question: Did he, now? Agent Myers, this is Agent Clay. Follow his lead.
answer: You're not coming?

question: Yup. Sixty years old by our count. But he doesn't age like we do -- think dog years
answer: What's with the hair, Clay?? Finally got those implants??

question: It'll fill in. Where do you want your dinner, Red? By the couch?
answer: Who's the squirt?

question: Agent Myers is your new liaison.
answer: Got tired of me?

question: Nah. I'll be around, Red, just back in the field.
answer: I don't want him.

question: Father's back? Still angry?
answer: Well, you did break out --

question: I wanted to see her. It's nobody's business.
answer: It is. You got yourself on TV again.

question: "Myers", huh? You have a first name??
answer: Try not to stare. He hates when people stare.

question: C'mon, Champ! Happy Halloween!!! You're taking me for a walk! Look at them ugly suckers, Blue. One sheet of glass between them and us.
answer: Story of my life.

question: I break it, they see us, Happy Halloween. No more hiding. Outside. I could be outside --
answer: You mean, outside... with her.

question: Don't get psychic with me.
answer: Nothing psychic about it. You're easy.

question: How am I ever gonna get a girl?? I drive around in a garbage truck
answer: Liz left us, Red. Take the hint.

question: Hold on -- hold on -- I thought we checked this place. Fakes, and reproductions.
answer: Apparently not everything was fake.

question: Father...?
answer: A 16th century statue was destroyed. Saint Dionysius the Aeropagite.

question: Who wards off demons.
answer: Smuggled into this country by an overzealous curator. The statue, however, was hollow --

question: Reliquary --
answer: A prison. The Vatican deemed its contents dangerous enough to include it on the List of Avignon. Of which we hold a copy.

question: Would'ya look at this babies? Made 'em myself. Holy water, silver shavings, white oak
answer: Behind this door. A dark entity -- Evil, ancient and hungry.

question: Oh, well. Lemme go in and say "hi". Blue Hey. Stinky. Kitchen's closed. Whatcha havin'? Six library guards, raw? Plus belts and boots? Man, you're gonna need some heavy fiber to move that out --
answer: Red, I found something -- There's not much here

question: hound of resurrection --
answer: See? I don't like that --

question: -- Hound of resurrection? harbinger of pestilence, seed of destruction --
answer: Skip to the end, willya? How do I kill it -- ?

question: All grown up, I see.
answer: That voice --

question: I sang the first lullaby you ever heard, my child. I ushered you into this world. I alone know your true calling, your true name.
answer: Don't tell me, it's Zeppo.

question: I can see that you're still young and don't know your place. Teach him.
answer: What do you think you're doing??

question: What do you think you're doing??
answer: Helping you -- I just --

question: No one ever helps me. It's my job. Damn -- Okay. Here -- -- Then load this. It's a tracking bullet. Crack the pin. Load it.
answer: Jeez... What the hell is that?

question: Lemme go ask --
answer: Wait! No, what are you doing? We'll hit the street in a minute. We're heading towards civilians... Yeah, yeah, crazy costume, uh? Trick or treat!!

question: Hey! Hey! I'm on your side!! Aw, I forgot -- Screw you. I'm fireproof. You weren't. Myers??? How's your arm?
answer: My arm is fine. Where are you?? Where are you???

question: I just fried Stinky. Tell Father I'll be home. He shouldn't wait up.
answer: Wait -- Wait -- You can't go anywhere -- I gotta go with you --

question: No, no, no, it's fine
answer: No. Stop. Don't do this -- Listen to me -- Tell me where you are --

question: Myers?
answer: Yes?

question: Every time the media get a look at him, they come to me. I'm running out of lies, Trevor.
answer: I thought you liked being on TV.

question: I do. How many escapes? This year alone
answer: Tom -- he's our guest, not a prisoner.

question: Your "guest" happens to be six foot five, bright red, and is government funded.
answer: He's just going through a phase --

question: A "phase"? What do you think this is, "The Brady Bunch?" These... freaks -- These freaks, Trevor, they give me the creeps. And I'm not the only one. You're up for review. You and your petting zoo.
answer: I know where to find him. I'll get him back.

question: Hey, fishstick -- don't touch anything --
answer: I need to touch it to "see"...

question: See what??
answer: The past, the future, whatever this object holds.

question: Is he serious??
answer: Don't worry about fingerprints. I never had any. They were over here, Professor.

question: Back so soon?
answer: Uh, I brought beer.

question: To wash down my lithium pills? I may get a few perks, H.B. But I'm still a patient. You better have that looked at.
answer: Just a scratch. I wanted to see you. We miss you at the Bureau. Abe's crazier every day. And Father's still mad at me -- Come back, Liz. Come back. I --

question: No. Not this time, H.B. It's been months since I've had an episode. And you know what? I'm learning to control it. I'm learning where it comes from. And for once in my life I'm not afraid. Looks like your ride is here.
answer: The Nanny Squad.

question: Yeah, I gotta go, too. Lots to do -- What took you so long?
answer: C'mon, time to go home. Tape you up.

question: What are you, a Boy Scout?
answer: No. I never was.

question: I'm lucky that way.
answer: Son. About Rasputin --

question: Don't worry. I'll get him soon enough --
answer: Listen to me. This time is different. There's more at stake than ever before.

question: How hard can it be? I punched the crap out of that thing that he sent -- ouch!!
answer: I worry about you.

question: Me?? C'mon --
answer: Well, I won't be around forever, you know?

question: We can't risk it
answer: I'm in way over my head, I know that much.

question: You're doing fine.
answer: No, I'm not. He respects Clay. Not me. I don't know why you chose me, Sir. But I'm not qualified.

question: I'm dying Agent Myers. And as a father, I worry about him. In medieval stories, Agent Myers, there's often a young knight, inexperienced but pure of heart...
answer: Oh, please. I'm not "pure of heart."

question: Oh, as opposed to -- ? Mmmh -- "Pamcakes." We're going out --
answer: Professor, that girl you were talking about --

question: Hey. You
answer: I think I can help -- Talk to her -- I can bring her back.

question: What landed you this job, pushing "pamcakes"? Punctuality? What was your area of expertise? What was that??
answer: Hostage negotiations. Miss Sherman? I'm Agent Myers, FBI. Miss Sherman? I'm Agent Myers, FBI. The hospital called us. They don't feel they're capable of caring for you any longer, and -- Liz -- can I call you Liz? It's a beautiful name --

question: Hostage negotiations. Miss Sherman? I'm Agent Myers, FBI. Miss Sherman? I'm Agent Myers, FBI. The hospital called us. They don't feel they're capable of caring for you any longer, and -- Liz -- can I call you Liz? It's a beautiful name --
answer: 60% OF THE WOMEN IN THIS WORLD ARE NAMED "LIZ".

question: It's still impressive by my standards Dr. Broom asked me to invite you back to the Bureau. No special precautions, no security escorts. You and me in a taxi. Like regular folks.
answer: Doesn't sounds like him.

question: Miss Sherman, he's asking you back, but it's entirely your choice.
answer: Choice, huh? That's cute. I've quit the Bureau thirteen times. I always go back. Where else would I go?

question: "Sammael Didn't I kill you already? Hey, Chunk-face! You can do better than that. Big monster like you. See? It hurts! You shouldn't hit people! Aw, crap. Second date. No tongue!! I hope that hurt. My job. This time. Stay dead, willya??
answer: Abe staggers out of the pool and hides behind a crumbling shower stall. Behind him, two SHAPES come to the surface.

question: Abe -- ?
answer: Hellboy enters to find Abe, bleeding but alive, leaning against the tile, blue blood all around him. Hellboy tries his walkie-talkie. Turns on his locator. It sparks. It's damaged and broken.

question: But not everyone was so lucky. Two agents died today. Clay probably won't survive the night. You're reckless.
answer: I knew those men better than you did --

question: Ah, I see. That makes it all alright then.
answer: No, it doesn't make it right, but I stopped that creature, didn't I?

question: That's what you do. That's why we need you. You have an insight. You know monsters.
answer: What are you trying to say?

question: In the end, after you've killed and captured every freak out there -- there's still one left
answer: I wish I could be more gracious but --

question: I'll get you a fresh pack. Where do you --
answer: Shh! Just a second. Myers, you're a talker. What's a good word -- a solid word for "need" --

question: "Need" is a good, solid word.
answer: Nah, sounds too "needy."

question: Oh, my God... Look at them all! Who had babies? C'mere, Tiger...!
answer: Um... Liz -- I -- there's something I'd like you to -- something I need you to hear.

question: Well. Is it long?? I'm going out, but --
answer: Out? Out out?

question: For a cup of coffee, but go ahead, read.
answer: You're going alone?

question: No. Myers is taking me.
answer: Him!! Why him? Why not me?

question: I admire him. He's a force of nature.
answer: He's just pushy.

question: No... He's determined. Unstoppable --
answer: Cocky.

question: Strong.
answer: A brute.

question: My uncle used to say... we like people for their qualities but love them for their defects. He -- loves you.
answer: I know.

question: What about you?
answer: Don't know. Really. I grew up with him. I've missed him too, but now, every time I see him, I get confused. Hardly a day goes by he's not in my mind. Even now, I feel he's here --

question: SEBASTIAN PLACKBA #16... Moscow. It's Rasputin's mausoleum. I see the puppet. But -- where is... the puppet master?
answer: Very good, Professor Broom.

question: It was you Moscow.
answer: His destiny. You raised the child. Nurtured him. So, In return... Would you permit me? A brief, brief glimpse? Of the future -- If only you had him destroyed sixty years ago, none of this would come to pass. But, then, how could you have known? Your God chooses to remain silent. Mine lives within me. In the frozen waters of the Malaya Nevka, in the darkness of the void

question: I know what to call him. Nothing you can say or do will change that. I call him son. I am ready.
answer: Good. Now, I'll add two crumbs more

question: Hi --
answer: Hi.

question: I've changed my mind. I'll come to Moscow. If you -- are still going --
answer: I am. But -- I have something to say, too. I never had the guts before - But I understand what you don't like about me. I do. What I am makes you feel out of place -- out there --

question: Red, I --
answer: Listen. I'm not like Myers. He makes you feel like you belong. And -- that's good. It really is. I -- wish I could do something about this -- But I can't. I can promise you only two things... One

question: I like that...
answer: Good.

question: "One falls, two shall arise." So
answer: When we do We've installed a very handy timer. Set it, walk away. Cable pulls the safety pins, K-boom! Easy to clean, easy to use...

question: Those things never work. Never.
answer: Each of us gets a belt.

question: On a scale of one to ten
answer: What's that -- We should go back -- you -- you could tear that door apart --

question: Don't move. We --
answer: -- should go back. Now!

question: No. Don't --
answer: I'm in charge. We go back!

question: Son of a --
answer: Ouch!!

question: Crap. This guy moves like a cockroach -- Screw that. You killed my father -- Give your soul to God, Your ass is mine.
answer: Well, it's not that big a fall...

question: Kroenen cautiously leans over the pit. He can't hear a sound. Kroenen goes to cut the rope...
answer: Oh, no you don't --
speaker1: INT. ABOVE THE HEXAGONAL TRAP DOOR PIT - DAY

question: Hellboy climbs out and sits. Sees Kroenen's blade embedded in the floor. Holding it Hellboy peers down. Still alive, Kroenen frees one arm, slicing through his own ropy bicep.
answer: You like playing possum, you Nazi pinhead? Then try playing dead.
speaker1: INT. ABOVE THE HEXAGONAL TRAP DOOR PIT - DAY

question: Manning sits down, bandaging his injuries. Hellboy kneels down.
answer: Are you okay? You'd better stay here. I'll find a way out. We'll come back for you.
speaker1: INT. ABOVE THE HEXAGONAL TRAP DOOR PIT - DAY

question: Are you okay? You'd better stay here. I'll find a way out. We'll come back for you.
answer: You call that thing a cigar??

question: Yup.
answer: You never, ever light a cigar that way. Use a wooden match. It preserves the flavor. Thank you.

question: So, he thinks that you and I... That's why he's mad at me -- But it's not true, is it?
answer: What -- ?

question: That you feel that way about me.
answer: You want to know -- Now -- ? Here? Red, white, whatever -- Guys are all the same.

question: Watch out. It's slippery...
answer: Oh, my God... Marco, Marco, Marco... Get your Big Red butt over here!

question: Hit me.
answer: What?

question: Hit me -- All of my life I've run away from it... Now I want it to happen! Do it.
answer: I can't, I --

question: No.
answer: No? In exchange for her life then, open the door. As you wish. She's dead.

question: Noooo! Noooo!!!
answer: Her soul awaits on the other side. If you want her back... Open the door and claim her.

question: For her.
answer: Names hold the power and nature of things. Mine for example. Rasputin
